properties.headline: RunWest - Sunday 28 March - EASTERN CREEK TO ROOTY HILL VIA BLACKTOWN Great Western Highway, Ferrers Road, Eastern Road, North Parade
properties.publicTransport: Free event shuttle buses will run from nearby car parks and train stations for event participants. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place while up to 6,000 participants take part in the 2nd RunWest event including a 12km and 4km fun run through Western Sydney.

The 12km course starts at 6:45am travelling from Sydney Motorsport Park, across the Great Western Hwy, through Sydney Zoo and Western Sydney Parklands to Blacktown International Sportspark finishing at West HQ in Rooty Hill. The 4km course starts at 10:15am travelling from Blacktown International Sportspark to West HQ via the M7 shared pathway.

Road closures:

  • Rooty Hill - From 3am to 2pm: sections of North Pde, Rooty Hill Rd Nth and Sherbrooke St.
  • Rooty Hill - From 6:45am to 11.30am: Eastern Rd between Knox Rd and Rooty Hill Rd South.
  • Eastern Creek / Huntingwood - From 6am to 9am: Brabham Dr between Ferrers Rd and Great Western Hwy, Ferrers Rd between Chandos Rd and Brabham Dr as well as sections of Huntingwood Dr, Peter Brock Dr, Rudders St and William Dean St.
  • Eastern Creek - From 6.30am to 8.30am: the Great Western Hwy will be closed between the M7 Mwy and Doonside Rd as well as the M7 off ramp to Great Western Hwy. Motorists should use the M4 instead during this time.

Special event clearways will be in effect between 3am and 2pm on roads along and surrounding the course including North Pde, Sherbrooke St, Rooty Hill Rd North, William Dean St, Peter Brock Dr, Huntingwood Dr and Rudders St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROOTY HILL

FROM 3AM TO 2PM

  • North Parade between Station Street and Rooty Hill Road North
  • North Parade (6) between Rooty Hill Road North and No. 70 North Parade (westbound)
  • North Parade between No. 70 North Parade and West HQ Carpark
  • North Parade (5) between West HQ Carpark and Mount Street
  • Perkins Street (6) at North Parade
  • Premier Lane (6) at North Parade
  • Rooty Hill Road North (6) between North Parade and 15 Rooty Hill Road North
  • Sherbrooke Street between Railway Street and North Parade

Notes:

5 Managed access for West HQ at Mount St.

6 Managed access for residents of 70-76 North Parade, Perkins St and Premier Lane

FROM 6:45AM TO 11.30AM

  • Eastern Road between Knox Road and Rooty Hill Road South

EASTERN CREEK / HUNTINGWOOD

FROM 6AM TO 9AM 

  • Brabham Drive between Great Western Highway and Ferrers Road
  • Ferrers Road (1) between Chandos Road and Brabham Drive
  • Huntingwood Drive between Liberty Road and William Dean Street
  • Peter Brock Drive (2) between the Alpha Hotel and Brabham Drive
  • Rudders Street between William Dean Street and Great Western Highway
  • William Dean Street from Huntingwood Drive

Notes:

1 Access to Gate A permitted for authorised vehicles only. Access to Gate D of Sydney Motorsport Park and Sydney International Dragway permitted for RunWest participants parking. No access to Brabham Drive.

2 Access maintained to Alpha Hotel Eastern Creek. Entry and exit from Hotel via Peter Brock Drive and Reservoir Rd only during closure times. 

EASTERN CREEK - GREAT WESTERN HWY

FROM 6.30AM TO 8.30AM

  • Great Western Highway (3) between Doonside Rd / Brabham Drive and M7 Motorway
  • Pikes Lane (4) at Great Western Highway

Notes:

3 Access from BagTrans maintained under direction of NSW Police and Authorised Traffic Controllers.

4 Access maintained from Pikes Lane under direction of NSW Police and Authorised Traffic Controllers.   

CYCLEWAY/SHARED PATH CLOSURES

FROM 6:45AM TO 11:30AM

  • M7 Motorway shared path Between Eastern Road and Station Street

properties.headline: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - Sunday 28 March - TURRAMURRA, KUR-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK, ST IVES Bobbin Head Road, Mona Vale Road
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: St Ives - Special event clearway map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic
arrangementAttachments.linkName: St Ives - Special event clearway map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic

arrangementAttachments.displayName: 27km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic
arrangementAttachments.linkName: 27km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic

arrangementAttachments.displayName: 57km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic
arrangementAttachments.linkName: 57km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic

arrangementAttachments.displayName: 104km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic
arrangementAttachments.linkName: 104km Route map - Bobbin Head Cycle Classic

properties.adviceB: Allow extra travel time; Exercise caution
properties.otherAdvice:
Riders will take part in the annual Bobbin Head Cycle Classic from 6.30am in one of 4 events including a 104km, 80km, 57km or 27km ride from Turramurra through Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park and return. 

Road and lane closures will be in place between 5am and 3pm along Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd and Woodbury Rd in Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah and St Ives as cyclists share roads with motorists.

Roads will reopen progressively as riders make their way along the course. 

Speed limit reductions will also be in effect between 6.15am and 1.30pm along sections of Mona Vale Rd, West Head Rd, Bobbin Head Rd, McCarr's Creek Rd and Pacific Hwy. Check signs carefully and drive to the conditions. 

Special event clearways will be in effect in St Ives from 7am to 1:30pm on the eastern side of Mona Vale Rd from Property No.425 to Kitchener St. Local parking restrictions will also be in effect between 5am and 1pm on sections of Eastern Rd, Karuah Rd and Toolang Rd in Turramurra and North St Ives.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

ST IVES - FROM 7AM TO 1.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road between Property No.425 to Kitchener St (Eastern Side)

LOCAL PARKING RESTRICTIONS

Changed and restricted parking will be in place a the following locations

TURRAMURRA

From 5AM to 8AM

  • Eastern Rd between Brentwood Ave and Chilton Parade (Northbound)
  • Karuah Rd between Turramurra Ave and Katina St (Both directions)  

From 5AM to 1PM

  • Karuah Rd between Turramurra Ave and Katina St (both directions)  

NORTH ST IVES

From 5AM to 1PM

  • Toolang Rd between Toolang Rd and 50m west of the intersection of Memorial Ave (both Directions)

FROM 8:30AM TO 1:30PM

FROM 8AM TO 1:45PM

arrangementElements.title: Road and Lane Closures

arrangementElements.html:
The speed limit will be temporarily reduced for the safety of cyclists riding amongst vehicle traffic at the following locations and times. Speed limit reductions affects both directions unless stated otherwise.

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 90KM/H TO 60KM/H:

BETWEEN TERREY HILLS AND ST IVES

  • 7am to 10.45am - St Ives to Terrey Hills on the eastbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Wildflower Gardens and Myoora Road
  • 8am to 1.30pm - Terrey Hills to St Ives on the westbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Forest Way and the Wildflower Gardens      

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 80KM/H TO 60KM/H:

7am to 12pm - Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park

  • West Head Road eastbound between Liberator General San Martin Drive and West Head Picnic Area
  • West Head Road westbound between West Head Picnic Area and Liberator General San Martin Drive

6.30am to 8.30am - Mount Colah

  • Mount Colah eastbound lanes of Bobbin Head Road from the Park Gates to Kalkari Visitor Centre

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 60KM/H TO 40KM/H:

MOUNT COLAH AND TERREY HILLS

  • 6.15am to 8.45am - Mount Colah, both directions on the Pacific Highway between Pacific Highway and Belmont Parade
  • 7.30am to 10.45am - Terrey Hills in both directions on McCarr’s Creek Road between West Head Road and Liberator General San Martin Drive

properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Thursday 1 to Monday 12 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses in the precinct will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 1 April until Monday 12 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

Attendees driving to the event should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online in advance as car parks typically reach capacity from the early morning on weekends.

Roads in the precinct will be closed from 2am Thursday 1 April until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave. 

Other roads in the precinct will be closed prior to the Show from 16 March to allow for event set up, and some roads will remain closed after the Show until 20 April to allow for the removal of event infrastructure.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within the Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be closed prior to the Show to allow for even infrastructure set up. Additional roads will close during the Show for crow safety and will remain closed until after the Show for event pack down.

FROM 1AM TUESDAY 16 MARCH TO APPROX. 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Olympic Boulevard 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue adjacent to the Cathy Freeman Park amenities to 200m south of Edwin Flack Ave outside Qudos Bank Arena

FROM 12:01AM THURSDAY 18 MARCH TO 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue

FROM 2AM THURSDAY 1 APRIL TO 6AM TUESDAY 13 APRIL 2021

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common Carpark to Australia Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) & Park Street
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road (Accessible drop off / pick up & Show drop off / pick up – Edwin Flack Avenue to Fig Grove)
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland to the Tennis Centre
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 Car Park
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

Roads may close prior to full-time to allow crowds to safely leave the area including sections of O’Connell St, Victoria Rd and Ross St.

properties.headline: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Sunday 4 April - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Bridge Rd approaching Sydney Fish Markets
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market will operate extended trading hours on Good Friday, 2 April from 5am to 5pm and regular trading hours for the remainder of the weekend until Sunday.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area, particularly on Good Friday.

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Limited parking is available at the main Sydney Fish Market car park entry via Bank St. Additional parking will be available on Good Friday at the Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.
properties.displayName: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Sunday 4 April

roads.mainStreet: Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Bridge Rd

properties.headline: Festival - Friday 19 to Monday 29 March - MAYS HILL Great Western Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Great Western Hwy at Mays Hill as gatherers attend Sydney Murugan Temple for events between Saturday 19 March and Monday 29 March. The busiest days are expected to be Friday 19 March, Saturday 27 March and Sunday 28 March. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 19 March - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Warriors v Knights at Central Coast Stadium, Gosford, from 6pm to approx 8pm, pre-game from 3:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game on Friday afternoon. 

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the game from 2:30pm and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A–League - Friday 19 March - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at Bankwest Stadium from 7pm until 9pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads may close prior to full-time to allow crowds to safely leave the area including sections of O’Connell St, Victoria Rd and Ross St.
